key.name: reopen
key.summary: Re-open the most recent file on program start
key.description: Controls whether HiTodo will re-open the most recently used file when it starts. If set to False, HiToDo will start with a blank task list.

key.name: show-toolbar
key.description: Controls whether the toolbar should be visible to the user.

key.name: use-tabs
key.description: When true, multiple task lists can be opened within the same window using a set of tabs. When false, every task list is shown in its own window.

key.name: open-in-new-window
key.summary: Open new files in their own window. Ignored when use-tabs is True.
key.description: When true, opening a new file will create a new HiToDo instance for that task list. When false, opening a new file closes the current file and reuses its window.

key.name: default-statii
key.description: These strings will automatically be available as task Status options for newly created task lists. Has no effect on saved lists.

key.name: default-assigners
key.description: These strings will automatically be available as task Assigner options for newly created task lists. Has no effect on saved lists.

key.name: default-assignees
key.description: These strings will automatically be available as task Assignee options for newly created task lists. Has no effect on saved lists.

key.name: col-order
key.description: The columns named here will be shown in HiToDo in the order listed. It's a terrible idea to leave out the "done" and "title" columns.
